response.answer_text: Here comes one of my “yes” and “no” answers! So, let’s start with why I say no. When it comes to affiliate marketing, the main thing you want to do is to build trust. You can’t just say, “Here’s my link, click on it and it’ll solve all your problems,” it just doesn’t work like that… anymore. So, you need to create content to show people that you know what you’re talking about and you’re not just blowing steam. This also allows people to warm up to you at their own rate. However, there are some people who will go as far as ask you to teach them, and you could literally give them the step-by-step guide and they don’t take action. So, why is that? Several reasons actually. One: They might not fully trust you. “But if they’re asking you to train them, wouldn’t that mean they trust you?” No, not really. We live in a time where people are so desperate to make money, they often get caught up in scams. So, even when they take the step to find out more information, they’re still looking for anything that may seem scammy to them. So, how do we come out not seeming scammy? You can’t for some. You can show them your proof, testimonies, and everything else to ease their mind, but if they want to see a scam, they’ll see one. With others, you have to be calm, helpful, honest, and transparent. Two: They get cold feet at the last moment. People are comfortable with the lives they’ve lived so far… No, comfortable is the wrong word… use to is a more fitting word. People are used to the lives they’ve lived so far, so when it comes to taking that first serious step to change their lives then they get cold feet. Now, I might get some people who will say, “Steven, it’s your job to make them feel comfortable to buy from you.” To which I say, in some cases that true. However, in most cases, it just not going to happen. Why though? Simple, they don’t really want it. Some people like talking about changing their lives and others like to take action to change their life. Guess which one has a better chance. Three: Some people just don’t want to make an investment. This is perhaps the most comment out of all. You see, we’re told to get good grades, attend college, and them a good-paying job as children. What people don’t say is, creating your own business cost money soon or later. We’re not told that because we’re raised to become workers, not entrepreneurs. So, when someone sees there’s a cost, then they might run away. People aren’t willing to invest in something that can be a long term gain as much as they are willing to invest in something that will be a short term pleasure. I realized all of this within two weeks of doing affiliate marketing without a blog. Why Yes Anyone willing to invest in their self with both time and money is rightful candidates to become the next successful affiliate marketer. If you can tell them with all honesty, “Hey, there’s a chance you won’t make money for a few months” and they still have that same fire in their eyes, then they can learn affiliate marketing. You see, affiliate marketing is hard, but if you can learn from someone else, then you have a better chance then those who’re trying to do it on their own. A person’s mindset plays a huge role in being an affiliate marketer, nah, and entrepreneur. You should read my answer here: Steven Horne's answer to Can you really make significant money using affiliate marketing? where I share a few different stories where the mindset is different, thus the success is different. So far, I’ve been able to help nearly 60 people make it as an affiliate or digital marketer. The BIGGEST difference between those who make it and those who don’t seem to be the mindset. “Dang Steven, it sounds like you’re putting everything on the buyer. What about your own shortcoming” Well, you got me there. Yep, except one thing. This isn’t something that happens to only me. This happens to experts for more often because they know how to bring in far more traffic than I do. So, if you’re looking to teach people affiliate marketing then just know this; you will have a lot of people asking you to teach them, but very few willing to make a commitment. Don’t get discouraged, because those who are willing to learn are amazing people. Plus, it feels good to see people on your team making bank like this:  Knowing that you can help someone make money like that, is an amazing feeling.
